result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R Aiken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jacob R Aiken in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing on warrant, quashed, 15 CF 336 to be set for sentencing, 18 CM 5, to be set for plea/sentencing,  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 6, 2019 at 02:45 pm.

If defendant does not appear for returns tomorrow warrant will be issued by Court. Return date scheduled for October 30, 2018 at 02:45 pm.
